DOC.brief_summary: Chest/abdominal wall varices and spider nevi are two common presenting signs of liver cirrhosis. Their prognostic values remain unclear.
DOC.brief_title: Prognostic Values of Chest/Abdominal Wall Varices and Spider Nevi in Patients With Liver Cirrhosis
DOC.criteria: 1. Liver cirrhosis. 2. Consecutive admission. 3. Permitted to physical examinations. 4. Informed consents. 1. Noncirrhotic portal hypertension. 2. Malignancy. 3. Uncontrolled infection. 4. Severe chronic diseases. 5. Poor patient compliance.
